title: Magnetic field - inside_outside wire w current

content.description: A wire of radius <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> has a current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> uniformly distributed through its cross-sectional area. The current generates a magnetic field of magnitude <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> at a distance <math alttext="lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> from the center of the wire. Which of the following best indicates the relationship between <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> and <math alttext="lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> for the regions inside and outside the wire?
content.question: Inside the wireOutside the wireA<math alttext="B is proportional to lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi><mo>∝</mo><mi>r</mi></math><math alttext="B is proportional to lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi><mo>∝</mo><mi>r</mi></math>B<math alttext="B is proportional to the fraction 1 over lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi><mo>∝</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>r</mi></mfrac></math><math alttext="B is proportional to the fraction 1 over lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi><mo>∝</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>r</mi></mfrac></math>C<math alttext="B is proportional to lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi><mo>∝</mo><mi>r</mi></math><math alttext="B is proportional to the fraction 1 over lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi><mo>∝</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>r</mi></mfrac></math>D<math alttext="B is proportional to the fraction 1 over lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi><mo>∝</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>r</mi></mfrac></math><math alttext="B is proportional to lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi><mo>∝</mo><mi>r</mi></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
